member.name: T:System.Index
member.summary: Represent a type can be used to index a collection either from the start or the end.

member.name: M:System.Index.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Construct an Index using a value and indicating if the index is from the start or from the end.
member.param: The index value. it has to be zero or positive number.
Indicating if the index is from the start or from the end.
member.remarks: If the Index constructed from the end, index value 1 means pointing at the last element and index value 0 means pointing at beyond last element.

member.name: P:System.Index.Start
member.summary: Create an Index pointing at first element.

member.name: P:System.Index.End
member.summary: Create an Index pointing at beyond last element.

member.name: M:System.Index.FromStart(System.Int32)
member.summary: Create an Index from the start at the position indicated by the value.
member.param: The index value from the start.

member.name: M:System.Index.FromEnd(System.Int32)
member.summary: Create an Index from the end at the position indicated by the value.
member.param: The index value from the end.

member.name: P:System.Index.Value
member.summary: Returns the index value.

member.name: P:System.Index.IsFromEnd
member.summary: Indicates whether the index is from the start or the end.

member.name: M:System.Index.GetOffset(System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculate the offset from the start using the giving collection length.
member.param: The length of the collection that the Index will be used with. length has to be a positive value
member.remarks: For performance reason, we don't validate the input length parameter and the returned offset value against negative values. we don't validate either the returned offset is greater than the input length. It is expected Index will be used with collections which always have non negative length/count. If the returned offset is negative and then used to index a collection will get out of range exception which will be same affect as the validation.

member.name: M:System.Index.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Indicates whether the current Index object is equal to another object of the same type.
member.param: An object to compare with this object

member.name: M:System.Index.Equals(System.Index)
member.summary: Indicates whether the current Index object is equal to another Index object.
member.param: An object to compare with this object

member.name: M:System.Index.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns the hash code for this instance.

member.name: M:System.Index.op_Implicit(System.Int32)~System.Index
member.summary: Converts integer number to an Index.

member.name: M:System.Index.ToString
member.summary: Converts the value of the current Index object to its equivalent string representation.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsExternalInit
member.summary: Reserved to be used by the compiler for tracking metadata. This class should not be used by developers in source code.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.SkipLocalsInitAttribute
member.summary: Used to indicate to the compiler that the .locals init flag should not be set in method headers.
member.remarks: This attribute is unsafe because it may reveal uninitialized memory to the application in certain instances (e.g., reading from uninitialized stackalloc'd memory). If applied to a method directly, the attribute applies to that method and all nested functions (lambdas, local functions) below it. If applied to a type or module, it applies to all methods nested inside. This attribute is intentionally not permitted on assemblies. Use at the module level instead to apply to multiple type declarations.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TupleElementNamesAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the use of on a member is meant to be treated as a tuple with element names.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TupleElementNamesAttribute.#ctor(System.String[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Specifies, in a pre-order depth-first traversal of a type's construction, which occurrences are meant to carry element names.
member.remarks: This constructor is meant to be used on types that contain an instantiation of that contains element names. For instance, if C is a generic type with two type parameters, then a use of the constructed type C{, might be intended to treat the first type argument as a tuple with element names and the second as a tuple without element names. In which case, the appropriate attribute specification should use a transformNames value of { "name1", "name2", null, null, null }.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TupleElementNamesAttribute.TransformNames
member.summary: Specifies, in a pre-order depth-first traversal of a type's construction, which elements are meant to carry element names.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.AllowNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that null is allowed as an input even if the corresponding type disallows it.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DisallowNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that null is disallowed as an input even if the corresponding type allows it.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MaybeNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that an output may be null even if the corresponding type disallows it.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that an output will not be null even if the corresponding type allows it. Specifies that an input argument was not null when the call returns.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MaybeNullWhenAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that when a method returns , the parameter may be null even if the corresponding type disallows it.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MaybeNullWhenAttribute.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the specified return value condition.
member.param: The return value condition. If the method returns this value, the associated parameter may be null.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MaybeNullWhenAttribute.ReturnValue
member.summary: Gets the return value condition.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullWhenAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that when a method returns , the parameter will not be null even if the corresponding type allows it.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullWhenAttribute.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the specified return value condition.
member.param: The return value condition. If the method returns this value, the associated parameter will not be null.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullWhenAttribute.ReturnValue
member.summary: Gets the return value condition.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullIfNotNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that the output will be non-null if the named parameter is non-null.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullIfNotNullAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the associated parameter name.
member.param: The associated parameter name. The output will be non-null if the argument to the parameter specified is non-null.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullIfNotNullAttribute.ParameterName
member.summary: Gets the associated parameter name.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DoesNotReturnAttribute
member.summary: Applied to a method that will never return under any circumstance.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DoesNotReturnIfAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that the method will not return if the associated Boolean parameter is passed the specified value.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DoesNotReturnIfAttribute.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the specified parameter value.
member.param: The condition parameter value. Code after the method will be considered unreachable by diagnostics if the argument to the associated parameter matches this value.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DoesNotReturnIfAttribute.ParameterValue
member.summary: Gets the condition parameter value.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullWhenAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that the method or property will ensure that the listed field and property members have not-null values when returning with the specified return value condition.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullWhenAttribute.#ctor(System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the specified return value condition and a field or property member.
member.param: The return value condition. If the method returns this value, the associated parameter will not be null.
The field or property member that is promised to be not-null.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullWhenAttribute.#ctor(System.Boolean,System.String[])
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the specified return value condition and list of field and property members.
member.param: The return value condition. If the method returns this value, the associated parameter will not be null.
The list of field and property members that are promised to be not-null.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullWhenAttribute.ReturnValue
member.summary: Gets the return value condition.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullWhenAttribute.Members
member.summary: Gets field or property member names.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that the method or property will ensure that the listed field and property members have not-null values.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with a field or property member.
member.param: The field or property member that is promised to be not-null.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullAttribute.#ctor(System.String[])
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the list of field and property members.
member.param: The list of field and property members that are promised to be not-null.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullAttribute.Members
member.summary: Gets field or property member names.

member.name: T:System.IStructTupleInternal
member.summary: Helper so we can call some tuple methods recursively without knowing the underlying types.

member.name: T:System.ValueTuple
member.summary: The ValueTuple types (from arity 0 to 8) comprise the runtime implementation that underlies tuples in C# and struct tuples in F#. Aside from created via language syntax, they are most easily created via the ValueTuple.Create factory methods. The System.ValueTuple types differ from the System.Tuple types in that: - they are structs rather than classes, - they are mutable rather than readonly, and - their members (such as Item1, Item2, etc) are fields rather than properties.

member.returns: if is a .

member.summary: Returns a value indicating whether this instance is equal to a specified value.
member.param: An instance to compare to this instance.
member.returns: true if has the same value as this instance; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:System.ValueTuple.CompareTo(System.ValueTuple)
member.summary: Compares this instance to a specified instance and returns an indication of their relative values.
member.param: An instance to compare.
member.returns: A signed number indicating the relative values of this instance and . Returns less than zero if this instance is less than , zero if this instance is equal to , and greater than zero if this instance is greater than .

member.name: M:System.ValueTuple`1.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether the current instance is equal to a specified object.
member.param: The object to compare with this instance.
member.returns: if the current instance is equal to the specified object; otherwise, .
member.remarks:
The parameter is considered to be equal to the current instance under the following conditions:
It is a value type.
Its components are of the same types as those of the current instance.
Its components are equal to those of the current instance. Equality is determined by the default object equality comparer for each component.

member.name: M:System.ValueTuple`1.Equals(System.ValueTuple{`0})
member.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether the current instance is equal to a specified .
member.param: The tuple to compare with this instance.
member.returns: if the current instance is equal to the specified tuple; otherwise, .
member.remarks: The parameter is considered to be equal to the current instance if each of its field is equal to that of the current instance, using the default comparer for that field's type.

member.returns: A signed number indicating the relative values of this instance and . Returns less than zero if this instance is less than , zero if this instance is equal to , and greater than zero if this instance is greater than .

member.name: M:System.ValueTuple`2.System#Collections#IStructuralEquatable#Equals(System.Object,System.Collections.IEqualityComparer)
member.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether the current instance is equal to a specified object based on a specified comparison method.
member.param: The object to compare with this instance.
An object that defines the method to use to evaluate whether the two objects are equal.
member.returns: if the current instance is equal to the specified object; otherwise, .
member.remarks:
This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the instance is cast to an interface.
The implementation is called only if other is not , and if it can be successfully cast (in C#) or converted (in Visual Basic) to a whose components are of the same types as those of the current instance. The IStructuralEquatable.Equals(Object, IEqualityComparer) method first passes the values of the objects to be compared to the implementation. If this method call returns , the method is called again and passed the values of the two instances.

member.name: M:System.ValueTuple`5.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether the current instance is equal to a specified object.
member.param: The object to compare with this instance.
member.returns: if the current instance is equal to the specified object; otherwise, .
member.remarks:
The parameter is considered to be equal to the current instance under the following conditions:
It is a value type.
Its components are of the same types as those of the current instance.
Its components are equal to those of the current instance. Equality is determined by the default object equality comparer for each component.

member.name: M:System.ValueTuple`5.Equals(System.ValueTuple{`0,`1,`2,`3,`4})
member.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether the current instance is equal to a specified .
member.param: The tuple to compare with this instance.
member.returns: if the current instance is equal to the specified tuple; otherwise, .
member.remarks: The parameter is considered to be equal to the current instance if each of its fields are equal to that of the current instance, using the default comparer for that field's type.

member.name: M:System.ValueTuple`5.CompareTo(System.ValueTuple{`0,`1,`2,`3,`4})
member.summary: Compares this instance to a specified instance and returns an indication of their relative values.
member.param: An instance to compare.
member.returns: A signed number indicating the relative values of this instance and . Returns less than zero if this instance is less than , zero if this instance is equal to , and greater than zero if this instance is greater than .

member.name: M:System.ValueTuple`5.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns the hash code for the current instance.
member.returns: A 32-bit signed integer hash code.

member.name: M:System.ValueTuple`5.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string that represents the value of this instance.
member.returns: The string representation of this instance.
member.remarks: The string returned by this method takes the form (Item1, Item2, Item3, Item4, Item5). If any field value is , it is represented as .

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.StringFormatMethodAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the marked method builds string by format pattern and (optional) arguments. Parameter, which contains format string, should be given in constructor. The format string should be in -like form.

member.name: M:JetBrains.Annotations.StringFormatMethodAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.param: Specifies which parameter of an annotated method should be treated as format-string

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.UsedImplicitlyAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the marked symbol is used implicitly (e.g. via reflection, in external library), so this symbol will not be marked as unused (as well as by other usage inspections).

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.MeansImplicitUseAttribute
member.summary: Should be used on attributes and causes ReSharper to not mark symbols marked with such attributes as unused (as well as by other usage inspections)

member.name: F:JetBrains.Annotations.ImplicitUseKindFlags.Access
member.summary: Only entity marked with attribute considered used.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Annotations.ImplicitUseKindFlags.Assign
member.summary: Indicates implicit assignment to a member.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Annotations.ImplicitUseKindFlags.InstantiatedWithFixedConstructorSignature
member.summary: Indicates implicit instantiation of a type with fixed constructor signature. That means any unused constructor parameters won't be reported as such.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Annotations.ImplicitUseKindFlags.InstantiatedNoFixedConstructorSignature
member.summary: Indicates implicit instantiation of a type.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.ImplicitUseTargetFlags
member.summary: Specify what is considered used implicitly when marked with or .

member.name: F:JetBrains.Annotations.ImplicitUseTargetFlags.Members
member.summary: Members of entity marked with attribute are considered used.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Annotations.ImplicitUseTargetFlags.WithMembers
member.summary: Entity marked with attribute and all its members considered used.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.PublicAPIAttribute
member.summary: This attribute is intended to mark publicly available API which should not be removed and so is treated as used.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.InstantHandleAttribute
member.summary: Tells code analysis engine if the parameter is completely handled when the invoked method is on stack. If the parameter is a delegate, indicates that delegate is executed while the method is executed. If the parameter is an enumerable, indicates that it is enumerated while the method is executed.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.PureAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that a method does not make any observable state changes. The same as System.Diagnostics.Contracts.PureAttribute.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.LinqTunnelAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that method is pure LINQ method, with postponed enumeration (like Enumerable.Select, .Where). This annotation allows inference of [InstantHandle] annotation for parameters of delegate type by analyzing LINQ method chains.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.NoEnumerationAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that IEnumerable, passed as parameter, is not enumerated.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.AspNet.Logging.OptionsBuilderExtensions.UseDefaultLogging(LinqToDB.Configuration.LinqToDBConnectionOptionsBuilder,System.IServiceProvider)
member.summary: Configures the connection to use the resolved from the container.
member.param: Builder to configure.
Container used to resolve the factory.
member.returns: The builder instance so calls can be chained.

member.summary: Configures the connection to use the passed in.
member.param: Builder to configure.
Factory used to resolve loggers.
member.returns: The builder instance so calls can be chained.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.AspNet.ServiceConfigurationExtensions.AddLinqToDB(Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection,System.Action{System.IServiceProvider,LinqToDB.Configuration.LinqToDBConnectionOptionsBuilder},Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.ServiceLifetime)
member.summary: Registers as the service in the . You use this method when using dependency injection in your application, such as with ASP.NET. For more information on setting up dependency injection, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=526890.
member.param: The to add services to.

param.name: configure
param.para: An action to configure the for the context.

member.param: The lifetime with which to register the Context service in the container. For one connection per request use (the default).

remarks.para: This will only work when you have 1 database connection across your whole application. If your application needs multiple different connections with different configurations then use or .
To Resolve the connection inject into your services.

member.returns: The same service collection so that multiple calls can be chained.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.AspNet.ServiceConfigurationExtensions.AddLinqToDBContext``1(Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection,System.Action{System.IServiceProvider,LinqToDB.Configuration.LinqToDBConnectionOptionsBuilder},Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.ServiceLifetime)
member.summary: Registers as a service in the . You use this method when using dependency injection in your application, such as with ASP.NET. For more information on setting up dependency injection, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=526890.
member.typeparam: The type of context to be registered. Must inherit from and expose a constructor that takes (where T is ) and passes it to the base constructor of .
member.param: The to add services to.

param.name: configure
param.para: An action to configure the for the context.
In order for the options to be passed into your context, you need to expose a constructor on your context that takes and passes it to the base constructor of .

member.param: The lifetime with which to register the Context service in the container. For one connection per request use (the default).
member.remarks: This method should be used when a custom context is required or when multiple contexts with different configurations are required.
member.returns: The same service collection so that multiple calls can be chained.

The concrete implementation type used to fulfill requests for from the container. Must inherit from and and expose a constructor that takes (where T is ) and passes it to the base constructor of .
member.param: The to add services to.

param.name: configure
param.para: An action to configure the for the context.
In order for the options to be passed into your context, you need to expose a constructor on your context that takes and passes it to the base constructor of .
